mods.abstract: WAS COMMITTED TO JAIL a Negro Man, who says his name is HENRY, and belongs to Dr. James Allgood, a Trader in New Orleans. Said slave says he was coming from Missouri, and ran off from the said Allgood whilst on his wy down the river. Said Henry is of black color --wears mustachoes -- strong built, and is near six feet in height -- aged about 30 years. The owner is requested to come forward prove property, pay charges and take him out of jail. MARCELIN AGUILLARD, Jailor. P't Coupee, Nov. 20, 1858.

detail.title: Pointe Coupee Democrat. : (False River [i.e. New Roads], Parish of Pointe Coupee [La.]) 1858-1864
